v.v: Then Yahweh said to Job,
“Do you still want to argue with me, the Almighty One?

v: Since you criticize me, you should be able to answer my questions!”

v.v: Then Job replied to Yahweh,
“Now I realize that I am completely worthless. So how could I answer those questions?
I have already said more than I should have said,

v: I will put my hand over my mouth and not say anything.
so now I will say nothing more.”

v.v: Then Yahweh again spoke to Job from inside a powerful storm. He said,
“I want to ask you some questions,
Are you going to accuse me and say that I am unjust?
Do you have the same amount of power as I do?
If you can do that, then put on the robes
Show that you are very angry;
Humble those proud people just by looking at them angrily!
Bury them in the ground!
If you do that, I will congratulate you
Think also about hippopotamuses.
Their legs are very strong,
Their tails are stiff like the branches of a cedar tree.
Their thigh bones are like tubes made of bronze,
Hippopotamuses are among the strongest of the animals that I made,
On the hills grows food for them to eat
They lie down in the water under the lotus plants;
The hippopotamuses find shade under the lotus plants,
They are not disturbed by raging, flooding rivers;
No one can catch them with hooks
“Think also about crocodiles.
Can you put ropes through their noses to control them
Will they plead with you to act mercifully toward them
Will they make an agreement with you to work for you,
Can you make them into pets like you do birds?
Will men who partner in selling fish try to sell them in the market?
Can you pierce crocodiles through their hides by throwing fishing spears at them?
If you grab one of them with your hands, it will give you a battle that you will never forget,
It is useless to even hope to subdue them.
No one dares to make a crocodile angry.
Also, everything on the earth is mine.
I will tell you about how strong crocodiles’ legs are
Can anyone strip off their hides?
Can anyone pry open their jaws, which have terrible teeth in them?
They have rows of scales on their back
The scales are very close together;
The scales are joined very closely to each other,
When crocodiles sneeze, the tiny drops of water that come out of their noses sparkle in the sunlight.
It is as though sparks of fire poured out of their mouths.
Smoke pours out of their nostrils
Their breath can cause coals to blaze
Their necks are very strong;
The folds in their flesh are very close together
They are fearless
When they rise up, they cause even very strong people to be terrified.
People cannot injure them with swords;
They certainly are not afraid of weapons made of straw or rotten wood,
Shooting arrows at them does not cause them to run away.
They are not afraid of clubs anymore than they would be afraid of men throwing bits of straw at them,
Their bellies are covered with scales that are as sharp as broken pieces of pottery.
They stir up the water and cause it to foam
As they go through the water, their wakes glisten.
There are no creatures on earth that I have created as fearless as crocodiles.
They are the proudest of all the creatures;

v: so act like a man and
get ready to answer my questions.
Are you going to say that what I have done is wrong, in order that you can say that what you have done is right?
Can your voice sound as loud as thunder, as mine can?
that show that you are glorious and are greatly honored!
show that you have the right to humble people who are very proud!
Crush wicked people quickly!
Send them to the place where dead people are,
where they will not be able to get out!
and say that truly you can save yourself by your own ability.
I made you, and I made them also.
They eat grass, like oxen do.
and the muscles of their bellies are very powerful.
The muscles of their thighs are close together.
and the bones of their legs are like bars made of iron.
and I, who created them, am the only one who can kill them.
while many other wild animals play nearby.
they hide in tall reeds in the swamps.
and they are surrounded by willow trees growing in the streams.
they are not even disturbed when rivers like the Jordan River rush over them.
or by piercing their noses with the teeth of a trap!
